intro: Saxifraga hispidula var. doniana, commonly known as the hairy saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine and rocky habitats in Europe. It features succulent, hairy leaves that help retain moisture in harsh environments. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in early summer, typically arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy species adapted to cold climates. Its compact growth habit and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
